name: NBCNews
text: WATCH: President Trump designates Wilmington, North Carolina, as the first World War II Heritage City in the nation. https://t.co/fWHR2aQh5S

name: NBCNews
text: Opinion | Adam Larson: "It’s important that we don't only fund studies that show immediate, useful results or we won't be able to defeat the viruses of the future." - @NBCNewsTHINK https://t.co/NSgVjVvFay

name: NBCNews
text: President Trump and Joe Biden will commemorate the 19th anniv. of the Sept. 11 attacks in rural Pennsylvania where one of the hijacked planes crashed in a field, the White House and Biden's campaign announced Wednesday. https://t.co/UgHm2jjgdr

name: NBCNews
text: Survivors of the 1921 Tulsa Race Massacre file a lawsuit against the city, county and other authorities they blame for leading one of America's "worst acts of domestic terrorism." https://t.co/l772E4YLJa

name: NBCNews
text: Digital vote suppression efforts are targeting marginalized groups, report warns. https://t.co/RUhU0qVbBY

name: NBCNews
text: Sylvester Francis, the founder of Backstreet Cultural Museum, a small, but highly respected museum that features aspects of African American culture in New Orleans neighborhoods, has died. He was 73. https://t.co/m3G7A5JziL

name: NBCNews
text: "Tell Me Why" includes the "first playable transgender video game hero from a major studio and publisher," according to the studio. - @NBCOUT https://t.co/SyHryZ9v4A

name: NBCNews
text: The raised fists of John Carlos and Tommie Smith at the 1968 Olympics are etched in sports history. Now, Carlos sees a new era of athletes pushing social justice forward. - @NBCBLK https://t.co/YAZvPj2Aq7

name: NBCNews
text:
RT @NBCNewsNow: “It really is a matter of life and death.” 

If you’re Black in America, you’re twice as likely to die of COVID-19…

But researchers say they’re having trouble finding enough minority participants for COVID-19 vaccine trials. 

@RonAllenNBC reports: https://t.co/U4UZMHn7bF https://t.co/v2ehOVCSRl

name: NBCNews
text:
An experimental medication may slow the progression of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, or ALS, researchers report

The research was supported in part by donations from Ice Bucket Challenge, the social media sensation that raised more than $200M worldwide https://t.co/rH9zHka5Hx

name: NBCNews
text: Conspiracy theories like those touted by QAnon often wildly misrepresent what human trafficking most frequently looks like, which can make it harder for real victims to get help, a fmr. prosecutor for the Philadelphia District Attorney's office says. https://t.co/cLxNvHJ1a1
